result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas E Geurkink

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 27, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

8:16 AM Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Thomas E Geurkink.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. V. Girard - Clerk 
22CF159, 22CF203, 22CF228, 22CF254, 22CF283, 22CF302, 22CF321, 22CF328, 22CM124, 22FO638
Atty Rivard - did speak with Mr. Geurkink yesterday- not sure of his position
Deft - not competent because being forced to take medicine
Atty Rivard - have read Dr. Minter's report - no agreement
Court - swears Dr. Minter on - appearance by zoom
State direct questions Dr. Minter
8:23 am Atty Rivard to cross
8:26 am Court questions Dr. Minter
Court receives & makes part of the record in the criminal cases the report filed by Dr. Minter
8:27 am Witness excused
Parties make arguments

Court - addresses jail credit - 22CF159, 22CF203, 22CF228, 22CF254, 22CF283, 
22CF302, 22CF321, 
22CF328 finds 40 days credit
Court has discussion re: jail incident - has deuterated significantly in mental health since being in custody
  did appoint him counsel without an application
  Finds he is not competent but likely to become competent within the next 12 months
  Lacks competency to stand trial

Have reviewed the criminal complaints, finds probable cause in Br 1 cases 22CF328 - has not been released after alleged Sept 17th incident
  Commit to Dept of Health services and see if restored competency within 12 months
  Finds he is mentally ill - is not competent to refuse medications - medications may be administered
  The criminal proceedings are suspended - Dept of Health services to submit 3 months, 6 months, 9 month, 12 month report
  To be transported forthwith
Status conference scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Determination of Eligibility for Public Defender Services
Amended from $400 cash to $2000 cash.  Must post additional $1600 cash.  No possession or consumption of alcohol.

1:42 PM Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF328, 22CF321, 22CF302, 22CF254

Bond Hearings

  - 22CF254- from $6000 cash to $10000 cash
  - 22CF302- from $2000 cash to $5000 cash
  - 22CF321- from $400 cash to $2000 cash

  - 22CF302- from $2000 cash to $5000 cash, must post additional $3000
  - 22CF321- from $400 cash to $2000 cash, must post additional $1600

State - asks for no contact with *address confidential*

1:15 PM Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared by video in custody from DCJ.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF321, 22CF254

22CF321 - INIT
Atty Lundeen - rcvd Complaint. Asks for Complaint to be dismissed. 
State - requesting $1,000 cash bond. No use or possession of alcohol. 
Atty Lundeen - argues
Court - orders $400 cash bond. No use or possession of alcohol. 
Atty Lundeen - unsure if DE will waive time limits for prelim. 
DE - speaks to Court
Court - sets speedy prelim

22CF254 - Bond 
State - asking to increase bond from $5,000 cash to $7,000 cash. Prior conditions to remain.
Atty Lundeen - argues. DE believes charges are without merit.
Court - Orders bond be modified from $5,000 cash to $6,000 cash. No contact with SMC dob: 5/18/53 and 512 17th St. NE, Menomonie, WI. No possession or consumption of alcohol, not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
